lessons.radicalBreakdown: 起 (ki) = to rise + ます (masu) = polite verb ending
寝 (ne) = to sleep + ます (masu) = polite verb ending
食 (ta) = to eat + べます (bemasu) = polite verb ending
飲 (no) = to drink + みます (mimasu) = polite verb ending
働 (hatara) = to work + きます (kimasu) = polite verb ending

liarGameData.trap: 食べる (taberu) is the dictionary form, not the polite form
liarGameData.correctVersion: 食べます (tabemasu) is the correct polite form
liarGameData.explanation: In Japanese, verbs have different forms. The dictionary form (食べる) is casual, while the polite form (食べます) is used in formal situations. Always use -masu form when speaking politely.

lessons.radicalBreakdown: 買 (ka) = to buy + います (imasu) = polite verb ending
売 (u) = to sell + ります (rimasu) = polite verb ending
高 (taka) = high/expensive + い (i) = adjective ending
安 (yasu) = cheap/peaceful + い (i) = adjective ending
いくら (ikura) = how much + です (desu) = is + か (ka) = question marker

liarGameData.trap: 高いです (takai desu) - You don't need です after い-adjectives
liarGameData.correctVersion: 高い (takai) is complete by itself
liarGameData.explanation: い-adjectives (like 高い, 安い) already contain the meaning 'is', so you don't add です. Only use です after な-adjectives or nouns.

lessons.radicalBreakdown: 暑 (atsu) = hot + い (i) = adjective ending
寒 (samu) = cold + い (i) = adjective ending
雨 (ame) = rain radical
雪 (yuki) = snow
春 (haru) = spring season

liarGameData.trap: 今日は暑いでした (kyou wa atsui deshita) - Wrong past tense
liarGameData.correctVersion: 今日は暑かったです (kyou wa atsukatta desu)
liarGameData.explanation: For い-adjectives in past tense, change い to かった, then add です. Don't use でした with い-adjectives.

lessons.radicalBreakdown: 電 (den) = electricity + 車 (sha) = vehicle
Katakana: バ (ba) + ス (su)
歩 (aru) = to walk + きます (kimasu) = polite verb ending
駅 (eki) = station
空 (kuu) = sky + 港 (kou) = port

liarGameData.trap: 電車で行く (densha de iku) means 'go by train', but で is the particle for means
liarGameData.correctVersion: 電車に乗る (densha ni noru) means 'ride the train'
liarGameData.explanation: Use particle で to indicate the means of transportation (電車で = by train), but use に with 乗る (noru = to ride) when talking about boarding.

lessons.radicalBreakdown: 家 (ka) = house + 族 (zoku) = tribe/family
両 (ryou) = both + 親 (shin) = parent
兄 (kyou) = older brother + 弟 (dai) = younger brother
友 (tomo) = friend + 達 (dachi) = plural marker
先 (sen) = before/ahead + 生 (sei) = life/birth

liarGameData.trap: 私の兄 (watashi no ani) vs お兄さん (onii-san)
liarGameData.correctVersion: Use 兄 for your own brother, お兄さん for someone else's
liarGameData.explanation: Japanese has humble and honorific forms for family members. Use plain forms (兄, 弟) for your own family, and honorific forms (お兄さん, 弟さん) for others' family members.
